Hubbell threw 4 times to Holke at 1B, which was unoccupied, giving Bigbee a walk in accordance with Rule 33.  No pitch was actually thrown to the batter.  Hubbell reportedly did the same thing a week earlier vs. Reds with Walker at bat. A few days after this second occurrence, NL Pres Heydler issued special instructions to umpires to prevent abuse of the rule.
Ump Quigley was so close to the play that Williams bumped into him just after the putout.  He was stunned but recovered shortly.
